07/05/24, 11:34 - Athish Sagar Marchanda HR TBC1: If your current org has a product team or needs an internal product to be built, pick that opportunity up.

I picked up a project to build a dashboard to manage 900 individual profiles of freelancers and project views for Producers. Took about 5 months to figure all the pain points and address, the more brutally honest your team is about the product the smarter you get.

11/05/24, 12:20 - Kunal Banerjee TA Specialist Freshworks: I think this will differ from different scale of organizations, and needs to be tailored based on the type of organization one is working for. 

The competency might change too, as this was 6-7 years back, and since then a lot of things have changed.
11/05/24, 12:21 - Clive Rodrigues HR Livspace: Absolutelely. But it's a framework everyone has got with Victor having put the effort. I think that's great. The power of sharing & free giving..
11/05/24, 12:21 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: <Media omitted>
11/05/24, 12:38 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: What has changed according to you?
11/05/24, 12:50 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: Because for me, this is the best competency measure one can ask for. It showcases what things each level should OWN. And ownership is one of the biggest trait differences in TA
11/05/24, 12:51 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: From both skill and team perspective
11/05/24, 15:12 - Kunal Banerjee TA Specialist Freshworks: That's what I told, it needs to be tailor made. 

And 6-7 years back things would have been different, and now if you see these competency would change. I have seen in few orgs, where junior folks are already doing great stakeholder management, employee engagement and many other things which falls under the lead category, but can we give that title? Answer would be possibly no, even if the answer goes yes to some extent, will they be paid at that level, answer - definitely no. One of the junior folk I'm only mentoring, and she is doing amazingly good, and she is already coming to a lead "as per the framework shared", but she is not. 

I'm not saying it's bad, or not disrespecting the fact from wherever it is coming from. 

What I meant is these framework needs to be tailor made to suit org needs. And, to do some more research on current standards. There needs to be an intent. 

Yaha sab kuch change ho rha hai, tech standards are changing drastically, why not TA frameworks.
11/05/24, 15:31 - Abhishek Nadagowd TA Apollo.io: <Media omitted>

14/05/24, 21:12 - Shruti Goyal Associate Manager TA Aidetic: Hi all, had a few questions to ask because we're trying to streamline our inbound hiring channel. Would love to understand your views on this. 

1. What are the hiring platforms you use for non tech mid to senior hiring and frontline sales hiring? - the channels you can inticrate with your current ATS tool  - like LinkedIn, IIM jobs , Naukri portal and other job boards like indeed .
2. How do you solve the problems of receiving a lot of junk/irrelevant profiles in your inbound and how do you optimise for attracting more relevant profiles? 
Itâ€™s always to put a filter on your search profiles under every position that is posted through the ATS platform. Your life will become easy if you inticrate/direct all the profiles to one sourcing point. Now those candidates who donâ€™t qualify those key skills set, put them to reject section and send the email to them.

3. How do you sift through the inbound profiles? Do add a friction in process like a form to be filled or by linking the platform application and ATS which then auto sifts through these profiles? 
Genrally we have a section of internal referrals, where the details of current employees and the referralâ€™s email is shared. You can streamline it. 


4. On an average, how many positions are closed by inbound applications?
Depends on how actively you are working on it.
14/05/24, 21:17 - Jaya Bhardwaj Sr. TA Manager Vimeo: This is based on what has worked for me.

1. LinkedIn works best for non Tech roles, specifically for Sales hirings Mid to Sr. roles, you will find great talent and you can tap them fast with Premium access.
I have also used Indeed free version for this, though it sends some irrelevant ones too. So a bit time consuming if you are ready to spend time.
2. Filter works great in ATS like Greenhouse to weed out irrelevant profiles by creating rules while posting a Job. This can also be solved by sending a quick job form manually/automatically at an Application review stage.
3. The mandatory filter/ questionnaires helps manage pipeline effectively.
4. â Generally quality of Inbounds are great if  youâ€™ve good market reputation and great social media presence. 
We have got 70% success with inbounds last year.
14/05/24, 23:08 - Shivani Pande Sr. Manager People Success Rocketium: Specifically answer for point 2 -

We have a mandatory Google form step. First level of screening is done based on a few hygiene parameters like experience (years, industry, etc. if the role demands it), work location, etc. at the next stage we setup a 2-3 question form and only the folks who fill that are evaluated further. This form usually has one question that asks for a self recorded video to answer a specific question. This has worked best for us so far in terms of high intent leads and also quality. <This message was edited>

14/05/24, 23:26 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: Very interesting question!!!

-What are the hiring platforms you use for non tech mid to senior hiring and frontline sales hiring?
* Linkedin, Naukri, Network, Employee referrals, Hirist, IIMJOBS, Good consultants who are good in sales hiring

-How do you solve the problems of receiving a lot of junk/irrelevant profiles in your inbound and how do you optimise for attracting more relevant profiles?
* One of the practices that we use is sharing few questions to be answered or an assessment or a case study depending on the role
* Positioning the Opportunity in relevant portals/communities - Check how and where target candidates are available.
* This is a process and it evolves after first week of application tracking for me

-How do you sift through the inbound profiles? Do add a friction in process like a form to be filled or by linking the platform application and ATS which then auto sifts through these profiles? 
- I would any day prefer to read profiles and make judgements than rely on keyword elimination. I don't want to miss even 1 good candidate just for a reason that he had not put up ATS friendly resume(only my personal way of working)

-On an average, how many positions are closed by inbound applications?
- Depends on how your company brand, opportunity positioning is attracting profiles!

15/05/24, 07:17 - Manikanta Reddy HR Inito: We do have case study for product and marketing roles. Till case study everything goes well when it comes to that ,the ratio who attempts case study falls down to 40 to 50.%

We try to give the case study towards the end of the week (Thursday and ask them to submit on Monday ). However very few will submit on time others do it when they are done. 

Those kind of roles TAT will be hit , we canâ€™t control once case study is given unless candidates is really interested in your organisation or seriously looking out for opportunities.

Other solution is keep building the pipeline strong if you know that only 30 to 40% is taking case study then make sure you give it to large number. If u want 10 case study submission then give it for 20 to 30 folks.

TAT/ positions per month: This depends on few things mentioned below 

1) selling the role rightly ,to right target audience. Get them excited about the opportunity you have 
2)you need a good branding ( a good brand attracts more applications ) which gives a better joining ratio.
 3) Which domain your product is.(I see candidates inclining towards fintech ,e-commerce products more ). Those companies are cash rich ğŸ¤‘ in terms of valuations and salaries pay too.

15/05/24, 09:27 - Kailuni Lanah HR TBC1: Working in a fast paced start up environment, I single handedly take care of HRBP and TA for one of our group companies (120 headcount ) moreover help our other group company in hiring tech and product and few Non tech roles, currently I work on 23 positions ( No external vendor support ). We donâ€™t have target and our TAT is 60 days. Sources: Naukri, LinkedIn, Instahyre, Bigshyft and Cutshort. <This message was edited>
15/05/24, 09:36 - Kshitij Gupta Lead TA Global Pixis. Ai: In a fast paced Startup, TAT for closures has to be less than 45 days. Each recruiter can manage 5-7 Requirements divided based on Priority for each role. P0, P1 and P2 (P0 being daily efforts required, P1 being every alternate day efforts required, P2 Is 2 - 3 hours of weekly efforts required to close). We have been doing this since last 3+ years and closing anywhere between 40-50 offers at an average each quarter. Highest feat achieved with same formula was 100+ offers and 90+ joiners with 4 recruiters without any vendor support. KRA's were set at team level as well as at individual levels too for each quarter.

https://www.linkedin.com/posts/gunjan-das-081514b4_recruitment-hiring-talentacquisition-activity-7196376582398054402-ZRy3?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop
15/05/24, 11:03 - Mehvish K HR Head Travelwings: Someone asked about hiring metrics.

You could use:
1. Cost Per Hire  
2. Time to Start - The average time taken from when the position opens till a candidate is selected and joins. 
3. TIme to Productivity - The average time taken from when the position opens till they can match the level of productivity of an employee who's been in the system at a similar level. 
_The last two help you reverse calculate how early you need to start looking for candidates for planned hiring._
4. Screen to Offer - This is from the time a candidate is screened (in case of outbound search) till they are sent an offer. We try to keep this <7 working days. 

Most of our searches are indeed outbound, we search on LinkedIn, pick up numbers from Naukri. 

We use Zoho One, so Zoho People as an HRMS and Zoho Recruit as the ATS. 

The biggest advantage of an ATS which I find is having your own mini database. I remember speaking with the Bigshyft guys when they were quite new, and it's always good to ask who are you not good enough for ğŸ˜…. They said Amazon is a pain, they already have profiles of every candidate we send them in their database. 

Which brings me to the other point this group is discussing, inbound applications are directly linked with your employer branding, if you are a recognisable brand in the industry, your inbound applications will be enough to close positions else outbound searches and recruitment vendor empanelment is what you'd need. Hope this helps. <This message was edited>

16/05/24, 19:51 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: Neha, I ran a meetup community in Pune for purely employer brand + quality hiring. Grew it to 2000+ folks over 6 months. We did an event every 3 weeks - tech talk on a solved problem, hackathon or yearly global day of code retreat (a worldwide event we registered and  hosted along 100s of other companies). 

Ops - Usually hosted by our architect, CTO from a partner company or insightful guest speakers from previous meets for lightning talks. Initially didnâ€™t stream the event to make it feel exclusive. Started streaming on Twitter & YouTube when crowd started hitting capacity. 2 hrs max (except code retreat was 6 hrs)

Deets - Completely free, all registrations on meetup site or Google form, pizzas for lunch at closure. Budget would be 5-8k per event. On avg 60-80% would turn up. First 3-4 ones we only got about 10 folks to come. Eventually 6 months down the line, 50+ would come which was our limit as we had a small office.

Hiring - I made 3 SSE hires from these events + 1 architect on consultant contract.
16/05/24, 19:53 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: I did this 6-7 years back. This would be way easier to do in todayâ€™s time + Bangaloreâ€™s active scene + new tools. <This message was edited>

23/05/24, 19:24 - Suyash Kumar: For over a decade, Jim Stroud has carved out a distinguished reputation in Human Resource strategy, offering his expertise to industry titans like Microsoft, Google, MCI, Siemens, Bernard Hodes Group (now Findly), and numerous startups. 

He is also a prolific author - having penned five books on HR, and his creative ventures extend to producing the YouTube series "The Jim Stroud Show" and "The Jim Stroud Podcast." He also brought to life "The Recruiting Life," a comic strip and newsletter that humorously delves into the intricacies of the workplace.

Jim's digital influence has also been spotlighted in renowned publications including Globe and Mail, US News and World Report, Wall Street Journal, and The Atlanta Journal.  His multifaceted career showcases his innovative spirit and significant contributions to the field.

1. Be professional
2. Treat others online as you would treat them in real life
3. Be tolerant towards othersâ€™ viewpoints; respectfully disagree when opinions do not align
4. Respect the privacy and personal information of other community members
5. Communicate with courtesy and respect

8. Strictly NO SPAM
9. Please keep your posts in any group on-topic

28/05/24, 13:43 - Shamini Abraham Culture & Talent Headout: Hello everyone, 
Working on setting up BGV process. Was looking for some inputs: 

1. What platform do you use for BGV? 
2. Do y'all undertake BGV for all incoming hires or only a subset of them. If it's the latter, then on what basis is the subset chosen (is it role/dept/hierarchy-wise or some other additional parameters are considered)?
3. Do y'all undertake a standard one-piece-fits-all approach for all hires where BGV is done or do y'all verify different parameters based on the role/person being hired
4. What type of BGV checks have yall opted for and what was the rationale for it
5. Do the documents need to be submitted/uploaded by the HR, or does the platform ask for documents from the candidate? Did you have a choice of choosing between the two? <This message was edited>
28/05/24, 14:03 - Prapti Talent Lead Setu: 1.â  â What platform do you use for BGV? _SpringVerify_
2.â  â Do y'all undertake BGV for all incoming hires or only a subset of them. If it's the latter, then on what basis is the subset chosen (is it role/dept/hierarchy-wise or some other additional parameters are considered)? _All full-time hires_
3.â  â Do y'all undertake a standard one-piece-fits-all approach for all hires where BGV is done or do y'all verify different parameters based on the role/person being hired. _We have a one-size-fits-all approach. It can be customised for exec hires if needed_
4.â  â What type of BGV checks have yall opted for and what was the rationale for it _Identity, court checks (includes address check too), employment checks (last 2 employers, no reference check), education check (highest degree). Rationale was that these checks suffice the elements we would want to check for any hires, and does not cause any legal implications later. For specific cases, we can include a ref check if necessary - eg. exec hires._
5.â  â Do the documents need to be submitted/uploaded by the HR, or does the platform ask for documents from the candidate? Did you have a choice of choosing between the two? _Yes, there is a choice, and we ask the candidates to upload it._
28/05/24, 14:04 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: 1)Genesis, springverify 
2) all hires
3)kmp diff and for rest other same 
4) basis clients you are going to work with and industry you are in this gets decided, at an avg 6 to 7 parameters are basic like employer check, kyc, education etc
5)both can be done, we let the candidate upload direct to save tat and integrated bgv software to our hrms <This message was edited>

30/05/24, 23:38 - Kailuni Lanah HR TBC1: This is how we did to move employees from Singapore 
1. Flight tickets for dependents (children and spouse)
2. 2 weeks stay in hotel 
3. â Food reimbursement for 2 weeks 
4. â Pay for brokerage 
5. â Reimbursement for moving household goods,â  if applicable
6. â Reimbursement for visa expenses <This message was edited>
30/05/24, 23:43 - Chinmaya B Head People & Culture Hyperverge: Thank you so much
31/05/24, 00:17 - Simar RR: Depends on the Tech stack but ideally it's 5:1
31/05/24, 00:38 - Kshitij Gupta Lead TA Global Pixis. Ai: Depends on role but for example we have 3-4 rounds of interviews. R1 is Exploratory call to do basic checks and mutual alignment of skills by one of the interviewer, then R2 Technical round to check Depth of mandatory skills then R3 covers Breadth of overall skills, and final round is cultural fitment or HMs discussion. Now ideally for every 5 candidates who reach Final round 1 should get offer. In worst case 7 anything above that the interview process should be reviewed if assessment is correct. Now for every 5 candidates to reach HM round atleast 7-10 go through Technical rounds. And for those 7-10 technical rounds atleast 12-15 screened and Shortlisted candidates to be lined up. And to get those 12-15 shortlisted candidates you may need to source 20-30 candidates, screen and shortlist top candidates meeting the criteria. Now it may happen that role gets closed in first 3 candidates you line up or in some cases when expectations are high from HMs it can take months to close as well. Good to backtrack and see what usually works for each skills, candidate pool size,  demographics, Quarter in which hiring request are made (Example Candidates are less likely to switch close to appraisals in quarter 4 hence even if people take offers there is high chances they use it to their benefits and negotiate internally) and many other variables. So there is no one size fits all answer to this.
31/05/24, 02:23 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: 5:1 is too high for 1 offer from 5 finalists. We should relook panel alignment with HM immediately if it goes above 2:1 and not let it go above 4:1. I feel terrible and a failure even with 3:1.
31/05/24, 02:25 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: Before Kshitijâ€™s message I was thinking everyone is a rockstar to be clearing 1 offer from 5 screening shortlists and I am dumbo ğŸ˜†
31/05/24, 06:00 - Kshitij Gupta Lead TA Global Pixis. Ai: Haha... As mentioned it is not one size fit all. Lot depends on recruiter screening and many variable factors. It's not always as easy as you said and Rockstar like yourself definitely knows that ğŸ˜‰

31/05/24, 13:29 - Sachin Mittal InterviewVector: try out our quickscreen assessments. we have 80% completion rate :)
31/05/24, 13:31 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: Our hiring managers prefer to design their own assignments which resonates with the work they will be doing. So for us it was more than number of completions, who completes it.
31/05/24, 13:33 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: so if someone has taken time to complete the assignment, and is shortlisted, probability of he clearing our tech panel is high. So our focus was on right people in our radar to complete the assignment.
31/05/24, 13:33 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: We also used Hackerrank for some roles.
31/05/24, 13:38 - Sachin Mittal InterviewVector: so there are pros and cons of both approaches. depends on at what time you want what.

If you are sending a 2-3 days or even a 6-8 hrs project assignment, nothing is a replacement for that. they are best. But if you are sending a 1-2 hr take home assignment, I have seen that the more crispier the assignment is, it's better since you are able to keep them engaged and the final shortlisting is almost same.
31/05/24, 13:41 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: Yes, it depends on what the desired output is. For some we have asked them to share Code and if good grilled them on their code source also. Time of submission was chosen by candidates similar to the way they estimate. This was one of the observations in our selection process, how they estimated, were they able to complete within that timeline if not how did they handle us...etc etc <This message was edited>

01/06/24, 11:58 - Mitchell Dudani TA Wildcraft: Recently, I spoke with a candidate who had a gap in his resume. When I asked about the reasons, he told me how he spent that time traveling and volunteering globally. He went on to explain how this experience gave him an exceptional adaptability and cultural sensitivity, qualities that are invaluable in our increasingly global workplace.

Lesson learned - Never underestimate the power of life experiences!

I jst read thia on LinkedIn.. N may be helpful for u..

It may be tough to get back after a break.
But I think u need to focus on positives, how it has helped u as a person.. What all have u done to keep u updated on trends / industry connects etc..
01/06/24, 12:05 - Salonee Bhatia Lead TA Tanla: I have had candidates who have taken a break for 6 months or more due to medical conditions, I just ensure they are healthy to come back to work. While some have due to family reasons take a break, life happens and judging someone based on that is wrong. 

Like Mitch said you will have to focus on the positives.
01/06/24, 12:06 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: I had a family member who went through this in covid, the company had taken back their offer and then it took the person a year to find the next role but we kept the person motivated and encouraged to do what they liked, finally got a role they wanted and we choose the path of honesty that helped
01/06/24, 12:13 - Mehvish K HR Head Travelwings: Hi Shweta,

Thanks for sharing. 
I think it's better to keep it simple and say that you were not keeping well and went to stay with your family.

Also, if something is suitable to your profile, go ahead and take that job at a lesser pay, work for 1.5 years and make up for the career gap professionally. You can bargain a higher pay while you're in the job while looking for other opportunities. 

You could compromise on money, a bit for a while, but do not compromise on the role. 

I say this because it is true that distance MBA candidates are less preferred in the job market, unfortunately, so once you land something focus on performance and upskilling. 

I will also say one year gap is nothing, we have returning mothers I have hired in my office after 3-4 years of maternity break and they are thriving.

Patience is going to be key.
And like other community members have said earlier - make a list of things that you learned in your gap year (without sounding too philosophical) and talk about them in the interview. 

Also, DM me your resumÃ©, let me see if I can refer. Thanks.
01/06/24, 12:18 - Saif Sayed HR Head Aiolos: Hey Shweta
Can you share your updated resume here and I guess we all can tap into our networks to help you out.

05/06/24, 13:50 - Kailuni Lanah HR TBC1: Thereâ€™s a noticeable trend where HR professionals often connect and engage with their network specially on LinkedIn, mainly when they are seeking new job opportunities or hiring for a particular role, and hide their profiles or limitating the connection requests by allowing only people who have their email IDs or in their contact list to connect, once they secure employment. This approach can limit the potential for building sustained, meaningful professional relationships and networking that can be beneficial in the long term, both for career growth and for fostering a supportive HR community.
Lots of HRs put â€œhiringâ€ in their profile but are never active on LinkedIn or respond to applications. 
Connections we get everyday on the platform will be beneficial in the long run either  to get you a job or you find them a job. 
Letâ€™s promote supportive HR community, helping others find their dream job. <This message was edited>

13/06/24, 18:30 - Kosha Trivedi Technical Recruiter TopHire: Adding on top of what everyone has mentioned, some candidates don't update their LinkedIn in the initial days of joining a new org, if they are looking out. 

If the recruiter/org proactively posts about their new joiners and tags them, it's all over their feed and lesser chances of candidates leaving soon after joining.

14/06/24, 11:15 - Supraja HR Lead Qapita: Hi Folks, could someone help me understand how many rounds are typically involved in hiring software architect or lead engineer roles?
14/06/24, 11:16 - Kunal Banerjee TA Specialist Freshworks: 4-5 rounds
14/06/24, 11:27 - Chandni Jumani RR: Initial assignment/ quick test, Recruiter screening, assignment, assignment review discussion, culture = 5 <This message was edited>
14/06/24, 11:30 - Manikanta Reddy HR Inito: Initial round can be basic screening ,

Second can be coding 

3rd design round HLD ( here we can have two ways give a task to design HLD and LLD and after that we can have assignment discussion )

4 Manager discussion 

Final HR discussion 

This is for leads or architect
14/06/24, 11:35 - Kunal Banerjee TA Specialist Freshworks: +1 to it. 

For leads / architects, I honestly don't recommend assignment/quick test. 

Instead a Bar-raiser round can be kept after/before managerial round, which can go deep dive into coding and system design. The Bar raiser is taken by someone very senior (who is purely into tech) like principal engineer, or staff engineer, or DoE (who is a hands on person)

01/07/24, 13:51 - Kavitha Kalaiselvi Director Talentegrity Consulting: Can someone tell me the statutory bonus clause on the eligibility? Is it mandatory for someone whose basic salary is less than or equal to 21k?
01/07/24, 13:59 - Sampath Arni Ravi HR TBC1: The statutory bonus eligibility criteria are as follows 
- Employees earning up to Rs. 21,000 per month are eligible for the statutory bonus.
- The employee must have worked for at least 30 days in the accounting year.
- The Payment of Bonus Act applies to factories and establishments with 20 or more employees.
- Startups and new establishments are exempt from paying the statutory bonus for the first five years.
Hope this is fine..

09/07/24, 17:08 - Rashi PANDITA HRBP Times Internet: Hi All Just need one help in glassdoor review activity for the organization
Is thr anyone in this grp with this expertise 

Thanks
09/07/24, 17:24 - Sampath Arni Ravi HR TBC1: If you're looking for expertise in this area, I can offer some general guidance.

To improve your organization's Glassdoor reviews, consider the following strategies:

1. Encourage employees to share their positive experiences on Glassdoor.
2. Respond promptly and professionally to both positive and negative reviews.
3. Address any concerns or issues raised in negative reviews.
4. Highlight your company culture, benefits, and perks.
5. Share updates and news about your organization.

Let me know if you need any further details around ! I am happy to help :)
09/07/24, 17:24 - Rashi PANDITA HRBP Times Internet: These are good pointers thanksğŸ˜Š
09/07/24, 17:26 - Kiranmayi Kalepalli Senior Recruiter Capgemini: Making sure deactivate the auto - pay if we donâ€™t want to continue <This message was edited>
09/07/24, 17:32 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: I had taken up this activity in the past when our glassdoor rating started to fall 4.8 to 3.6...

Sometimes when companies take some change mgmt strategic activities this happens. And during that phase much can br done internally. I enquired with many in the network and received these inputs :

- recognize those employees who can be ambassdors to drive positivity, happiness, opportunity in tough times and collaborate with them to drive things both internally and externally
- we weren't even owning the page and we decided to keep it that way
- Reaching out to people who had written negative comments and understand more for their unhappiness and take corrective measures
- if anonymous, reply in the comment section
- I used to ask people in the interviews if they have seen our reviews and ask if they have any questions/ queries directly to me. <This message was edited>
09/07/24, 17:34 - GV Sridharan Director TA & Ops Astuto: My Few pointers for improving Glassdoor rating

-	Get your leaders on board to read reviews and fix common problems in the culture; otherwise, your efforts won't matter.
-	Flag negative Glassdoor reviews with valid reasons; about 20% don't meet Glassdoor standards and can be removed.
-	Wait a week for Glassdoor to remove invalid negative reviews, then respond politely to show you care about addressing concerns.
-	Motivate your satisfied employees to leave 5-star reviews on Glassdoor to boost your ratings.
-	Share employee activities and reward pictures on Glassdoor regularly to engage your audience. 
-	Make your workplace happier with fair pay, good benefits, a friendly atmosphere, and opportunities for growth.
-	Simplify the interview and feedback process to ensure a positive candidate experience.
-	Always keep an eye on your Glassdoor ratings and adjust your efforts based on feedback.

Keep in mind, that the key is to make your employees happy, which often results in better ratings.
09/07/24, 17:35 - Kiranmayi Kalepalli Senior Recruiter Capgemini: This sounds good
09/07/24, 17:41 - Rashi PANDITA HRBP Times Internet: Thankyou this helps

17/07/24, 11:29 - Mehvish K HR Head Travelwings: Hi Basant,

In general of course, you can encourage hiring managers to assess the current diversity ratio of their teams and if they have the choice between candidates of similar calibre then fill the position to ensure diversity. 

Proactive way to do this is to run a selective *Leadership Program* to strengthen your current staff and ensure women/ diverse groups get representation as decision makers. Parallel to this, you can run a diversity/ women *Allyship Program* to train the managers of the selected group to also encourage and allow more autonomy among diverse groups and nurture their growth. This would be like a mirror program to the leadership one. 

Diversity is not necessarily having representation across various groups, it is also that no matter your background, your skill set is all that matters. This is a generic training that everyone could do as a part of onboarding checklist.

18/07/24, 07:23 - Athish Sagar Marchanda HR TBC1: Fascinating how the media and a few LinkedIn influencers are fear mongering.

What are the local unions asking for? 
Implementation of Sarojini Mahishi report of 1989 which suggested reservation in Group C and D jobs in Government and Private sectors.

What is Group C and D?

Group C - Operations, Field work and clerical jobs
Group D - Peons, Gatekeepers, sweepers and semi skilled labours

Why is this demand being made?
The argument is that a majority of Private firms acquired land in the state after converting it from an agricultural plot, this is an opportunity cost for the locals. Hence the move is to balance out the situation.


I hope you'll make your own conclusions based on the above naunces. Also, there is a chance that the courts will strike the bill down and state Congress blames opposition for the stunt.

â€¢	Limit of exemption at capital gains proposed at Rs 1.25 lakh a year
â€¢	STT on F&O hiked to 0.02% and 0.1%
â€¢	Corporate tax rate on foreign companies reduced to 25%
â€¢	Limit of LTCG hiked from 10% to 12.5%
â€¢	Short term gains on certain financial assets will be 20 percent, rest is applicable tax rate
â€¢	Long term capital gains will be 12.5 percent
â€¢	Listed financial assets held for more than a year will be classified as long term
â€¢	TDS rate on e-commerce operators to be reduced to 0.1 percent from 1 percent
â€¢	Tax rate of 20 per cent on certain assets. Rest to attract applicable rates
â€¢	Listed financial assets held for more than a year will be classified as long term
â€¢	Unlisted bonds and debentures, irrespective of holding period, to attract CGT as pwer applicable rates
â€¢	Abolishment of Angel Tax announced for all classes of investors
â€¢	Professionals in MNCs who get esops and then invest in movable assets abroad of upto Rs 20 lakh decriminalized / non-penalised
â€¢	Under new tax regime, standard deduction hiked to Rs 75,000 from Rs 50,000
â€¢	Deduction on family pension for pensioners to be enhanced to 25K Rs
â€¢	Salaried employee will save Rs 17,500 in income tax
New tax regime Tax rate structure to be revised as follows:
â€¢	  0-3L -- 0%
â€¢	 3-7 L -- 5%
â€¢	 7-10 L -- 10 %
â€¢	 10 - 12 L -- 15 %
â€¢	 12 - 15 L -- 20%
â€¢	 over 15 L -- 30%

31/07/24, 23:14 - Clive Rodrigues HR Livspace: It's the same as insurance TPAs. The newer providers are trying to create a platform experience but when it comes to grass roots, the older players are really strong with their subject. From getting discounts, to including lives even though they were not insured on time. They are able to influence decision makers. However slowly the newer players are starting to find their grounding..
31/07/24, 23:16 - Clive Rodrigues HR Livspace: Honestly none do for me ğŸ˜‚.. I've realised you need to know what you want. Research & ask them questions & also push them to include whatever you want/need
31/07/24, 23:17 - Clive Rodrigues HR Livspace: Even with a big 4. They will give you templates that are completely outdated. Same with the smaller players. This was my overall experience even through demos.
31/07/24, 23:17 - Clive Rodrigues HR Livspace: So before you decide. Ask them to provide you a framework of what they would do. What they need from you. Do you own research. Get things in place etc...

05/08/24, 20:08 - Ipshita Ray HR Ops Specialist Tricog: What is garden leave?
05/08/24, 20:08 - Rajesh Muralidharan Recruitment Manager Capgemini: Garden leave is a transition period for employees who give or are given notice of termination, keeping them on the payroll but away from the workplace. Under the leave, employees are prohibited from working for the competition or themselves.

12/08/24, 18:25 - Suyash Kumar: 1. Be professional
2. Treat others online as you would treat them in real life
3. Be tolerant towards othersâ€™ viewpoints; respectfully disagree when opinions do not align
4. Respect the privacy and personal information of other community members
5. Communicate with courtesy and respect
12/08/24, 18:25 - Suyash Kumar: 6. Avoid using the group for DMs - If thereâ€™s a topic that only concerns you and one other person, please DM them about it.
7. Strictly NO BUSINESS or EVENT PROMOTIONS allowed in the community without the ADMIN'S EXPRESS APPROVAL
8. Strictly NO SPAM
9. Please keep your posts in any group on-topic
12/08/24, 18:25 - Suyash Kumar: 10. DO NOT share any memberâ€™s contact details with a 3rd party without their express consent
11. Do not DM other members for sales purposes without their permission, unless you have a pre-existing relationship with them

1. **Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad (IIM-A)**
   - Location: Ahmedabad, Gujarat
2. **Indian Institute of Management Bangalore (IIM-B)**
   - Location: Bangalore, Karnataka
3. **Indian Institute of Management Calcutta (IIM-C)**
   - Location: Kolkata, West Bengal
4. **Indian Institute of Management Lucknow (IIM-L)**
   - Location: Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh
5. **Indian School of Business (ISB)**
   - Location: Hyderabad, Telangana / Mohali, Punjab
6. **Xavier School of Management (XLRI)**
   - Location: Jamshedpur, Jharkhand
7. **Faculty of Management Studies (FMS)**
   - Location: Delhi
8. **SP Jain Institute of Management and Research (SPJIMR)**
   - Location: Mumbai, Maharashtra
9. **Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM-I)**
   - Location: Indore, Madhya Pradesh
10. **Indian Institute of Management Kozhikode (IIM-K)**
    - Location: Kozhikode, Kerala

Tier 2 MBA Colleges in India:
1. **Narsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies (NMIMS)**
   - Location: Mumbai, Maharashtra
2. **Institute of Management Technology (IMT)**
   - Location: Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh
3. **Symbiosis Institute of Business Management (SIBM)**
   - Location: Pune, Maharashtra
4. **Management Development Institute (MDI)**
   - Location: Gurgaon, Haryana
5. **Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS)**
   - Location: Mumbai, Maharashtra
6. **Great Lakes Institute of Management**
   - Location: Chennai, Tamil Nadu / Gurgaon, Haryana
7. **KJ Somaiya Institute of Management**
   - Location: Mumbai, Maharashtra
8. **Institute of Rural Management Anand (IRMA)**
   - Location: Anand, Gujarat
9. **Indian Institute of Foreign Trade (IIFT)**
   - Location: Delhi / Kolkata, West Bengal
10. **International Management Institute (IMI)**
    - Location: Delhi

27/08/24, 09:09 - Vikas Sawant Sr. TA CommerceIQ: Hi Neha,

I guess the challenge is there in both immediate joiner and 30 days notice period,both sides of people will make the best of the situation by taking a counter offers.
What personally have helped me getting that trust from candidate in first call by pitching transparently,if candidate is from same city get them for f2f atleast for last few rounds more effective that virtual. <This message was edited>
27/08/24, 09:09 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: Company where i waz heading people function waz runnning both services and product verticals , both in different tech stack. We had rolled out offers to people with 90 days NP. There were hardly any dropouts! It all  starts from how passionately we as recruiters position the opportunity that matches with their career aspirations and yes having a good buffer plan. 

Immediate joinerz and quality is not always matching...so building a strong talent pipeline is crucial. 

I also openly told people to inform me if their mind changes as we depend on them and practically need time to search again. People have informed as well in couple of tumes.

So its about having multiple ways to ensure talent availability to business, which suits your geography, culture , role and growth opportunities. <This message was edited>
27/08/24, 09:25 - Athish Sagar Marchanda HR TBC1: + having backup candidates until the offered person walks through the office doors on DOJ is heavily underrated

We still might fail here as we have rolled out offer only to one. If he doesn't join and the other 2 are not available, we again reach to 0. So if budgets and team structures permit, roll out for 2, also have identify internal potential candidate pipeline and build them

28/08/24, 14:16 - GV Sridharan Director TA & Ops Astuto: Hello Rashida, According to Law, you cannot do anything

28/08/24, 14:17 - Kavitha Kalaiselvi Director Talentegrity Consulting: Go through the exit NDA. Generally, there will be some clause. Go through that and you will have to stick to that.
28/08/24, 14:18 - GV Sridharan Director TA & Ops Astuto: Nothing Holds in Law
28/08/24, 14:18 - GV Sridharan Director TA & Ops Astuto: in employment NDA
28/08/24, 14:19 - GV Sridharan Director TA & Ops Astuto: Use this clause "As per <Employee's Name>'s obligations laid out in the contract of employment, he/she is expected to adhere to the terms related to confidentiality, intellectual property, non-solicit, non-compete, and other relevant policies to which he/she is bound to, during his/her tenure with <Name of the Organisation>.

29/08/24, 10:27 - Clive Rodrigues HR Livspace: While they might be a core employee, when you state that you are trying to protect you IT & other confidential data, how much of this data is present with the employee? Ideally I'm guessing everything is created on official company assets & not on any employees personal drive. If you have the right security protocols, you data should remain intact. 

Coming to confidential data, many times what we presume is confidential is not considered the same in the court of law. 

It's actually near to impossible for someone to replicate exactly what another org is doing, coz every founder wants a differentiated offering. And growth of revenue is not only due to your product but also the actual service output.

01/09/24, 06:32 - Chinmaya B Head People & Culture Hyperverge: Good morning everyone,
I am approaching this experienced cohort with a challenge Iam facing. 
Ours is a 10 years old start up company. Till last year we had unlimited leave policy, which means there was no cap on max number of day of leave and likewise we did not have leave encashment or leave carry forward.

As we are now scaling and we have around 250 employees, our founders decided to implement a cap on leave and introduced a new policy with around 24 days leave including  casual leave and sick leave. As a result, people started asking about leave encashment and leave carry forward. 
Though we have a HRMS where people are supposed to apply for leave to ensure we have a record of leave taken by each employee, the culture is yet to grow and managers are not enforcing application of leave before proceeding on leave. Further, as we have flexible working hours and compensatory offs we dont intend to allow leave encashment or carry forward.

My queries to you all:
1.â  â Is it mandatory by any law to have leave encashment or leave carry carry forward or is it a company policy matter?
2.â  â If I revert back to unlimited leave policy and if an employee resigns , is he entitled to leave encashment? 

Looking forward to your advice folks
Regards and thanks in advanceğŸ™
01/09/24, 06:40 - Akshay Kulkarni Jio TA: Dear Chinmaya. Happy Sunday ğŸŒ

Please refer to the below link for everything about Leave Encashments. May be of some help to you.

https://www.zoho.com/in/payroll/academy/payroll-administration/leave-encashment.html#:~:text=Leave%20encashment%20refers%20to%20the,forward%20to%20the%20next%20year.
01/09/24, 07:07 - Harika Velaga RR: Good morning Chinmaya. Leave encashment is not mandatory. It is a firms decision if they want to provide this benefit or not.
01/09/24, 07:51 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: If you understand leave policies according to labour law, emoyees earn 1 leave after they work for 20 days. This Earned leave is employees right. If they dont take it, it has to be enclashed. Now how much is encashed, how much is carry forwarded, when do you want them to encash ( annualy or at exit ) is dependent on the policy you make. Sick leaves are not carry forwarded or encashed. <This message was edited>
01/09/24, 08:10 - Chinmaya B Head People & Culture Hyperverge: Thank you folks. Really helpful.ğŸ™
01/09/24, 09:35 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: Hey Harika 
As per shop act Leave encashment of upto 45 is mandatory <This message was edited>
01/09/24, 09:36 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: On what stage you want to do leave encashment is upto the org
They can choose to do it end of each year or during f&f settlement when the staff is leaving
01/09/24, 09:40 - Shweta Govila HR Manager Abhi Loans: Also, encashment is done on the basis of basic of salary
01/09/24, 09:49 - Harika Velaga RR: Hey Krishna this varies per state right? How do orgs in different states handle this? I was told by a legal counsel that in case of unlimited leaves this doesn't apply.
01/09/24, 09:55 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: What labour courts / shops & establishment act of each state is that employees are getting their minimum. Maximum is as per each company policies.
01/09/24, 10:20 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: Leave encampment will still be there with a capping as per shop act 
Each states shop act mentions it in the act
01/09/24, 10:21 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: This again has contesting 
As per a new ammendment it is to be done on gross and not basic but orgs still continue to choose gray are in this

01/09/24, 11:13 - Tejaswi Vajinepalli Asst. Manager HRBP LEAD: This 45 days is not for an year. That's the max cap that is according to the law. In general, companies allow around 10 days of earned leaves for every year carry forward for accumulation. Max Cap is mostly limited to 40 days in many companies.
01/09/24, 11:14 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: Correct 
Itâ€™s the max capping military vetoing which it will collaps
01/09/24, 11:15 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: Again max capping is purely on the shop act they fall under that states the capping limit for the lifetime of the employee journey
01/09/24, 20:58 - Aman Agrawal HRT Consultant KPMG: Encashed as per basic pay. That is also by law. Basic is generally 40% of the fixed. So it isn't quite rewarding

06/09/24, 22:30 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: How much should be the avg cost of payroll for a 30 to 35 cr arr org ?
06/09/24, 22:36 - Manikanta Reddy HR Inito: When we were making 5M$ our head count was about 70 (Engineering + manufacturing + production) our payroll cost was less than 1cr
06/09/24, 22:37 - Manikanta Reddy HR Inito: Today our ARR is 20M$ and head count is about 220 and monthly payroll cost is less than 3cr
06/09/24, 22:37 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: You folks are saying yearly payroll right ? <This message was edited>
06/09/24, 22:43 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: I assume it is monthly
06/09/24, 22:43 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: For a 50 people team we had touched 60L/ month
06/09/24, 22:43 - Clive Rodrigues HR Livspace: Ideal range is 25-30% but it can be much higher for services organisations or labor intense, such as delivery etc..
06/09/24, 22:44 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: Engineeringvand Sales teams constitutes the major %
06/09/24, 22:44 - Clive Rodrigues HR Livspace: And again this all depends on what you are building, hire fast you want it out in the market etc. Accordingly, you will decide to over index
06/09/24, 22:44 - Manikanta Reddy HR Inito: Monthly payroll cost
06/09/24, 22:44 - Clive Rodrigues HR Livspace: Also which exact functions comprise your headcount
06/09/24, 22:46 - Clive Rodrigues HR Livspace: So for 30-35 cr ARR, payroll can hover anywhere between 20-50% depending on the functions that comprise your headcount.

09/09/24, 17:03 - Mridusha Bhaduri Sr. TA Specialist: Hi folks!

Need some suggestions!!

I want to elevate myself and pursue a certificate course in HRM from a tier 1 college. I have a total of 5 years of experience. And I come from an MBA (HR) background.
09/09/24, 18:25 - Suyash Kumar: <Media omitted>
09/09/24, 18:26 - Suyash Kumar: Thank you @â¨Ashwini Kumar Madireddy HR TBC1â© for sharing this
09/09/24, 18:52 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: Let me share what I did, Mridusha. I was a CS grad and a dev/analytics person for 3 years before realising I am interested in HR. I did Ops, BP, Recruiting, EB for 4 years in a way I made for myself - imperfect but from the ground up. And then I realised I am going to hit a wall soon so I did a 1.5yr course from TISS - they call it SVE  program (school of vocational education: https://sve.tiss.edu/TISS/) and seems it has been rebranded now to something else. But my 2019 course was classroom in gurgaon with coursework and faculty from TISS visiting each weekend (that centre is now closed). This course was eye opening because I was studying with leaders who had handled strikes in manufacturing or handled 10k+ span in mother dairy or something similar. I learnt a lot from people and coursework here, and it helped me a lot in my program work at Unacademy in thinking and executing broadly.
09/09/24, 19:00 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: Last year, I realised I need to think more strategically and know more about demonstrating value to CSuite folks, so I did a 6-month certificate course from NUS held online (https://executive-education.nus.edu.sg/programmes/global-hr-leaders-program-hrlp/) where 40 people crowd was from 12 different countries and gave me a very rich understanding of cross border issues that HR leaders need to handle for CXOs. Many of those issues I had not even envisioned. Half faculty was NUS faculty and other half were CHROs from HP, Schindler etc. I actually got more from this than my TISS course. I also paid 3x for this than my TISS ğŸ˜‚ but it was definitely worth it for me in the long run. Alumni network in both cases is strong.
09/09/24, 19:01 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: Hope it helped
09/09/24, 19:03 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: You should not look at only tier 1 courses, but courses which will help you in the timeframe you need them to help you - short term or long term. They can come in the form of technical courses too. So just go for it! 
PS - Do the courses for learning and not a branding stamp because these courses havenâ€™t helped me in getting interview calls, but they definitely improved me as a professional.

17/09/24, 10:11 - Zoheab Rehaman Plum Head HR: Hi Folks, needed some help here:

For BDRs and Sales AEs based in India and focused on global customers, do you have any data on:

17/09/24, 19:35 - Rashmi M TA Consultant GrowthX: Hello folks,

Quick question- 

Case : An employee joins a company on a x date and resigns after a week. 

Now is it termination of employment mail which has to be sent or an offer revoking email?
17/09/24, 19:37 - Sindhu J Thaakur HR Consultant: Offer cannot be revoked once the person has joined the company
17/09/24, 19:38 - Sindhu J Thaakur HR Consultant: Also he has resigned formally (I hope) hence termination of employment is also not advisable
17/09/24, 19:39 - Sindhu J Thaakur HR Consultant: U need to accept the resignation, clear dues if any and give him employment letter
17/09/24, 19:40 - Lakshmy K HR TBC1: Has the appointment letter been issued?

17/09/24, 19:45 - Mehvish K HR Head Travelwings: Then don't pay anything and forget them. For real.
17/09/24, 19:47 - Mehvish K HR Head Travelwings: This happens a lot when you hire for sales. 
If you still want to be super safe, drop them an official email saying you have absconded from work and are unresponsive and the company is not liable to pay any dues. This way you protect yourself against any legal mess.

25/09/24, 18:08 - Abhishek Singh Assistant Manager TA Accion Labs: 1. Bench period: Employees can typically stay on the bench for [90] days before any action is considered.


2. Severance pay: In case of separation, severance pay is based on the employee's tenure. The notice period is generally 60 or 90 days, depending on the role and terms of employment.

30/09/24, 20:21 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: Sharpen one's own design sense first:
1. Train yourself atleast 2-3 times with https://cantunsee.space/
2. Do 2-3 live sourcing with your designer HM for 30 mins each, once a week. note what doesn't work for him/her.
3. Resumes matter less for designers, portfolios are king. But a poorly designed resume should be a reject (too many colours, strange fonts, incorrect typefacing, etc)
If the portfolio already has examples of the assignment you want to give them, skip it. If they worked in a company before which solved the problem the assignment covers, skip it. Go directly to scheduling them with HM and then subsequent rounds (be especially attentive in rounds with product managers)
30/09/24, 20:23 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: ask to shadow 1-2 rounds with each stakeholder (but mostly final round person won't be comfortable with this). but most design folks will be happy to include you that you want to be so involved and understand their craft <This message was edited>

05/10/24, 08:35 - Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit: Hi Guys, 

I just wanted to understand that while doing reference checks in India for a very Senior Role, do we initiate an email, call the references, or a mixture of both if needed?
05/10/24, 08:48 - Ajith KP Director Talent Stellaris: An email is the best way, if there is no response, then a call is warranted
05/10/24, 08:56 - Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit: Wanted to understand, why are calls not the preferred mode? Since, it can give us a better understanding.
05/10/24, 08:57 - Ajith KP Director Talent Stellaris: This is a for a very senior role and referrees will also be senior, they wouldn't appreciate a cold call. A connect from the candidate will help, else an email followed by a call is the right approach <This message was edited>
05/10/24, 09:00 - Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit: Hm, thought the same. Thanks alot for the help.
05/10/24, 09:01 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: Yes, send a mail asking for a time to speak or informing them youâ€™ll call at so-and-so time and do the check on call. Theyâ€™re not going to write to you, theyâ€™re ultra busy people. Do the call post 8/9 pm for very senior folks, thatâ€™s when theyâ€™re actually free
05/10/24, 09:03 - Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit: Noted. I think a call might be a bit weird considering we are hiring a director and the references will also be somewhat at the same position.
05/10/24, 09:03 - Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit: Not sure, if HR's out their do call.
05/10/24, 09:04 - Clive Rodrigues HR Livspace: Is this a reference that was provided by the candidate or is this a blind ref check. 

For blind - you should get someone you know to introduce you to the reference. 

For non-blind reference;
Send an email to the reference to seek a date & time that works for a call while also seeking confirmation that they are ok with a call.
05/10/24, 09:04 - Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit: Non-blind reference.
05/10/24, 09:05 - Clive Rodrigues HR Livspace: So its a peer reference. That's fine as long as you are aligning on the context of what you seek from that reference..
05/10/24, 09:07 - Kulika Dua Asst Manager HR WeCredit: Understood. Thanks!

17/10/24, 08:20 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: <Media omitted>
17/10/24, 08:23 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: A good read 
The typical notice period for tech jobs varies significantly between the US and Europe. In the US, it's common for employees to provide 2-3 weeks of notice, sometimes up to 4 weeks, as a courtesy. This period isn't typically mandated by law, and employees can technically leave their job at any time Â¹.

In contrast, European employment contracts often require a much longer notice period, typically 3 months or more. This extended period is designed to provide employers with sufficient time to find a replacement and ensure a smoother transition. However, it can also limit labor mobility and impact wages Â¹.

It's worth noting that notice periods can vary across European countries. For example, Germany has longer notice periods, while Greece has shorter periods, sometimes as short as 2 weeks Â¹. France also has a relatively standard notice period of 30 days, with employees required to pay the employer for each missing day if they fail to provide adequate notice Â¹.

*Notice Periods in European Countries:*

- _Germany_: Longer notice periods
- _Greece_: Shorter notice periods (as short as 2 weeks)
- _France_: 30 days

Overall, understanding the typical notice periods in the US and Europe can help you navigate the job market and plan your next career move.

17/10/24, 08:58 - Anjali Sathya TA Manager CADeploy Engineering: Shopping around the offers mostly we face it with active job seekers compared to passive ones is what I observed in my recruiting experience 

Coz the passive seekers will seek to gather more information during the screening call and let us know at first if they don't want to continue further wherein for active the first priority is on who pays highest and better benefits and infrastructure rather than focusing on career path and as we know mostly these are the ones who again switches the jobs in less than a year
17/10/24, 09:05 - Anjali Sathya TA Manager CADeploy Engineering: But then we have to be very careful while probing to active seekers, why are they looking out for change (is it role change? Financial?  Circumstances? Etc.,) this way we can have better understanding on the candidates. I have seen many juniors who just explain role, and schedule the interview call rather than understanding of the candidates (the call duration max ends in 5 mins) later coming back n saying candidates has dropped and he got better opportunity why not ours companies is best option to him? 

Understanding the role and candidates, plays a major role here to build a good relationship which helps to bring the best and aligning the right fit in job role

 in, it gives you the data on performanceğŸ‘ <This message was edited>
24/10/24, 15:34 - Kiranmayi Kalepalli Senior Recruiter Capgemini: Adaptive compensation strategies are crucial for retaining niche skills
24/10/24, 15:34 - Jeevitha Mohan Sr. Exec HR Mirrar: It's kind of mixed , there are tech people, sales , Hr and the salary range differs for everyone. Few are on lesser package side and few on higher range.

We thought of giving it on bases of their rating percentage for instance if we rated someone 4 so their percentage will be 10 but here is the problem, people with High package and receiving 10% makes sense but people on a lower side 10% will be very less to them. 
So wanted to understand how to go about this ?
24/10/24, 15:35 - Nataraja Nanjundaiah Credit Audit Payroll Expert: it is an allignment between how u want to compete with your indusrty competitor in your sector. and the talent and ability brought by the employeeâ€¦. so if the person is skilled and might negotiate outside then u should look for offering hike accordinngly to retain. Also there are other retention strategies including esops and company culture matters
24/10/24, 15:37 - Nataraja Nanjundaiah Credit Audit Payroll Expert: u should devise the performance scorecard taking all parameters both subjective and objective, it is a detailed exercise which has to be done and make sure everyone understands. though u will still have someone challenging but it is continous improvement exercise
24/10/24, 15:41 - Manikanta Reddy HR Inito: In this case what you can do is have a benchmarking for the role of the employees and make a correction and top it give the percentage 

This way you are making sure employees are rightly paid
24/10/24, 15:42 - Sampath Arni Ravi HR TBC1: As per my knowledge here is the data points :: 
1. Early-stage startups (0-5 years): 10-20% annual hike
2. Growth-stage startups (5-10 years): 15-25% annual hike
3. Established startups (10+ years): 20-30% annual hike

â€”â€”â€” OR 

Avg performer - 4 to 6%
Good performer - 10 to 15%
Outstanding performer - 25 to 30% 

I am not sure for specific to technology / industry .
24/10/24, 15:48 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: Also it depends on what budget we hired initially , budgets for this role, if the person grew beyond the role, etc etc finally.....

3. Be tolerant towards othersâ€™ viewpoints; respectfully disagree when opinions do not align
4. Respect the privacy and personal information of other community members

20/11/24, 09:22 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: Most offer letters mention a line beyond the notice period that it is subject to change as per company policy. So you donâ€™t need to send revised letters unless this line is not mentioned
20/11/24, 09:25 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: While we are on offer letters (and slightly off topic), regular reminder not to put non-compete clauses as scare tactics in your offer letters because non-compete is inadmissable in Indian court if the employee joins your competitor and challenges the contract terms in court. You will lose.

22/11/24, 17:35 - Swapna Kole: Hi all, can anyone share their referral policy please ğŸ™
22/11/24, 17:39 - Nilesh Godle HR Consultant Thence: 1. If the candidate has applied directly then the profile can be considered as a referral only after 6 months
2. If two people are referring the candidate, whoever is referred first will be considered as the primary referral or the candidate has to confirm on the primary referer
3. For payout, the referrer and the referred candidate both have to be active employe at the time of payout (should not be serving notice)
4. Out of 30k of referral bonus, 5k is paid after completing 1st month and balance 25k after completing total 3 months with the company

23/11/24, 10:05 - Chinmaya B Head People & Culture Hyperverge: Good morning Folks, 
As a 10 years old B2B SaaS start up with about 250 people, we have migrated from unlimited leave to a capped leave system. We want to align with other orgs in similar phase, size or age in crafting our leave policy.

I am compiling a Google sheet for data points on leaves by various orgs.

Could you please share data for the orgs you have worked or you are aware of in the following manner:
1. Name of org:
2. Size (No. Of employees):
3. Age(Years since raising)
4. Types and Number of days of leave offered.
5. Leave encashment allowed (Y/N) and how many days:

Thank you all ğŸ™ŒğŸ™ğŸ«¡
23/11/24, 11:13 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: Few things you may want to consider while designing leaves are:
- Do you want it to be shops and establishment act compliant? If you have offices in different states then design it according to that state.
- Look at funding/cash flow situation of your company which actually decides paid leaves apart from what has to be given minimum. Will this cost be ok for company even it scales to more employees? 
- Avg age groups of the employees as the needs might differ
- Should be simple and easy on admin mgmt
- Last but not the least employees should feel it a useful one <This message was edited>
23/11/24, 11:16 - Chinmaya B Head People & Culture Hyperverge: Thank you Kumuda.
Till now we were not compliant with  S and E Act.  But I feel, as we scale and grow in size, it is safer to be compliant. 
Average age is 23-25 yrs. <This message was edited>

8. Strictly NO SPAM
9. Please keep your posts in any group on-topic

12/12/24, 12:44 - Neha Lakhwani Capillary: anything else ? <This message was edited>
12/12/24, 12:44 - Sunit Desai Sr. Manager People Experience CashFlo: Normally I try doing proactive pipeline building in two scenarios:
1). *When the recruitment is little slow*, then I take up mapping projects, by figuring out which departments might need talent in future, or which departments regularly need talent after specific intervals. By doing this, it will save your time in search, when an actual requirement comes up, you will just to connect with the talent pool.
2). *When I make an offer to a candidate*, I have a devised a scoring system which has multiple factors in it personal & professional, which help me determine a percentage score of the candidateâ€™s joining probabilty. Based on the joining percentage I get an idea if I need to actively keep on searching for backups on not. If the joining percentage seems low, then I proactively keep on building a backup pipeline, by doing 1st round of interviews with backups and keeping them warm.
12/12/24, 12:46 - Neha Lakhwani Capillary: sure thanks Sunit - great idea

13/12/24, 14:05 - Salonee Bhatia Lead TA Tanla: Hi All,

I'd like to hear your thoughts on offering leave during probation.

Currently, we don't have any defined leave policy for probation periods. Employees can take leave in case of an emergency, but it would be considered as Leave Without Pay (LOP).

Before considering any revisions to the policy, I wanted to understand how other companies are handling this.
13/12/24, 14:09 - Varun Kapadia Asst Manager Checkmate: Our company offers 2 consecutive days of leaves during probation. These are paid leaves.
13/12/24, 14:14 - Sampath Arni Ravi HR TBC1: 1 paid leave during probation period . After completion of probation itâ€™s 1.25 paid leave added by month on month .
13/12/24, 14:17 - Ipshita Ray HR Ops Specialist Tricog: We have 3 months probation, we offer them 1 leave per month for the 3 months. If they finish their 3 leaves then the leaves taken after that will be LOP. 

Once confirmed they have earned leaves that is 1.5 leaves every 20th of the month for 12 months. This way they utilize their leaves plus ofcourse we have the casual and sick leave

22/01/25, 15:31 - Prapti Talent Lead Setu: Folks, need quick info regarding labour laws. Is it mandatory to conduct criminal background check for employees or is it something organisations do to safeguard their interest and minimise risk?
22/01/25, 15:31 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: Not mandatory
22/01/25, 15:32 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: If you are catering to certain clients itâ€™s needed and for the companyâ€™s own safety
22/01/25, 15:32 - GV Sridharan Director TA & Ops Astuto: Not Mandatory.... but if you are getting compliance certifications and if the employee works for any BFSI client, then it is needed
22/01/25, 15:34 - Clive Rodrigues HR Livspace: Not mandatory however if you have b2b clients, they could mandate it, before sometime is deployed to their projects (more IT services) or it could be cases where it's consumer facing & the impact of not doing a background check could be severe - ola or uber drivers..
22/01/25, 15:52 - Kunal Banerjee TA Specialist Freshworks: Its required for audit per se, and certification (like ISO, or Hippa, Or pci dss) which depends on the kind of business you are in.

27/01/25, 20:43 - Varsha Singh HR Manager INDMoney: Hi Everyone,

I wanted to gather some insights on an industry-specific query. What is the standard practice followed when an employee joins an organization but leaves immediately within 2-3 days (usually citing reasons like receiving a better offer or being in the final stages of another interview process before joining)?

Specifically, Iâ€™m curious to know:

Are such cases considered as formal employment and recorded in the system?
Is there a probationary clause that comes into play in such situations?
What are the common practices regarding salary payouts, documentation, and relieving formalities?


It would be great to hear your thoughts or learn about how your organization approaches this scenario. Looking forward to your input!
27/01/25, 21:29 - Shivaraju K P TA Manager OppDoor: If the employee has not been formally onboarded, you can revoke the offer and close the case.

If onboarding is complete and the employee's details are recorded, termination clauses can be applied for immediate exit without salary, provided they violated the agreement. However, if the employee worked even briefly and raises a labor dispute, it could become an issue.

The best approach is to discuss and resolve the matter amicably with employee as this will be an issue later on for them if there is a background check. If employee agrees, avoid recording the employment details. If the employee insists on salary, ask them to resign formally, serve the notice period as per the probation clause, and process their salary, PF, TDS, etc and issue a relieving letter.

04/02/25, 21:19 - Shraddha Agrawal HR Manager ClearFeed: I disagree here, since I hire mostly for Node.js dev for both freshers and senior roles in a start up. I often find it challenging to find quality candidate with JS experience and most of the top tier talent in our case for senior dev (in terms of their previous exp and project) have come from python background and have cracked out 3 rounds of tech interviews better than other folks from Java and JS. But we have also been able to find good JS candidates. So canâ€™t say depends on the pool you are getting and the overall candidature than the tech stack solely. 

Also, salary here has nothing to do with the language but rather on the job role and requirement. 
- Say if the dev is required only to do maintenance  work and small fixes then their salary band could be lower than other devs who are building the product or features from scratch and handling the whole software architect, and supervising junior devs. <This message was edited>

This has been my exp. In the previous startup that I worked, we were hiring language agonistic but for Java , we have to hire from the same language given its vast and depth...

05/02/25, 12:12 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: This message was deleted
05/02/25, 12:27 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: Adding what we did though it might differ from company to company on HR initiatives & Challenges:

1. Hiring Status : Offers made, Drop ratio, Joinings, Talent Pipeline, New Hiring requests and budgets required.
2. Attrion data
3. eNPS if  employee engagement surveys were done
4. Any employee feedbacks/concerns that mgmt should be aware of
5. Bonus / Performance pay / Successions planned.
6. Compliance related updates and Risk mgmt if any
7. Glassdoor/ Google review ratings or any other employer branding metrics
8.  New initiatives if required from People function and its impact, budgets required.

Hope this helpsğŸ‘ <This message was edited>
05/02/25, 13:39 - Roopa Puranikmath Sr. Lead Kyndryl: MBR are totally metrics driven, considering this is your first review you should take structured approach likewise, some of the slides can be as backup slides for subsequent meetings. 

1) Set the Context - Process Area/Function area/Project information, Team details, process flow, Scope, timelines etc.
2) Key Metrics - Yearly Targets --> followed by Quarterly Target.   
3) Target vs Actual Current Progress with supporting bullet points on key highlights of actual progress. Drawing some color codes R/B/Y to bench mark progress status is impactful
4) For Major Metrics drivers consider Highlighting them separately.  For Ex - out of $100 budget, $30 is consumed by XYZ, $ 20 by PQR
5) Action Plan for next quarter
6) Challenges anticipated with Mitigation Plan.  Do not forget to call out of support required if any.
05/02/25, 14:12 - Chinmaya B Head People & Culture Hyperverge: Hi Folks,
We are planning to transition from 4 level rating system (Does not meet expectations, Meets expectations, Exceeds expectations and Exceptional)  to 5 level rating system 
1. Needs Development
2. Often Meets Expectations
3. Sometimes Exceeds Expectations
4. Always Exceeds Expectations
5. Exceptional / Sets a new Standard
Needed inputs from you all who are already on a 5 level rating system if this is running well in your org?
Is having Sometimes Exceeds expectations in 3rd place okay, and not taken as mean performance?
Needed guidance on pay for performance for these ratings.
Thank you folksğŸ™ğŸ˜‡ğŸ«¡
05/02/25, 14:21 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: What caused you to change it ?
05/02/25, 14:23 - Chinmaya B Head People & Culture Hyperverge: People who were just above meets expectations could not be placed in meets Or Exceeds expectations justfully. We wanted more granular assessment to help managers place a person appropriately.
05/02/25, 14:30 - Vijin V R HR Rebid: This message was deleted
05/02/25, 14:33 - Akarshita Mehra Sr. Recruiter InterviewVector: In my prev. org, we transitioned from a 5 to a 6 scale rating for the same reasons. As there was not enough clarity where to place the one who often met expectations.
Although, for us, 1 and 2 were both performance intervention ratings (1 having graver implications like PIP).
So far you do not want that distinction, this 5 scale rating seems fine so far it solves your purpose.
05/02/25, 14:33 - Vijin V R HR Rebid: Hi Team,
Any recommendations for recruitment agencies or partners to close a Business Development position with Advertisement and Marketing agency-specific experience.
05/02/25, 14:33 - Krishna Vyas Carnot Lead HR: All my orgs we always used 5 star rating system 
Our logic was to have precise buckets in which folks can get added <This message was edited>
05/02/25, 15:01 - Fireside Shiffana MK: If the company size is less than 200 - I would keep the ratings simple and invest more in managers to have them evaluate performance fair and right + ensure right communication is reaching people. Adding more buckets in my opinion seems to be a surface level problem solving where bucket 3 and bucket 4 are quite based on intuitions and not math (eg: what is sometimes , what is always? - often its a feeling unless supported by % of cases which is hard to gage for all projects)

If manager investment and standardization is hard such as huge company size where HRBPs are few in number, may be such fixes help for sometime :)
05/02/25, 15:15 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: Agree with this. We had simplified to 3 ratings:
- Needs Improvement
- Meets expectations
- Exceeds expectations
05/02/25, 15:15 - Kumuda Rao Co-founder Stochast: More the options , more the confusion
05/02/25, 15:21 - Shivani Pande Sr. Manager People Success Rocketium: For similar reasons of keeping limited options for simplicity, we chose 4 levels:
- Way beyond expectations [Very few people get this]
- Above expectations
- â Met Expectations
- â Needs improvement

12/02/25, 09:11 - Nidhi Kumar HR Head Imagekit.io: Sourcing and screening:
Mass mailing and then to the interested candidates who responded, ask required details on mail, easy to filter by this way and then call only the best suited. Save the time to call everyone.
Job posting- again follow same approach to shortlist.
Interview Setup: 
Take 1-2 full day availability from panel and set as many interviews you can on those dates.
Interview rounds:
Ask panel to create a  questionnaire with minimum basic requirement to filter very poor candidates.
Keep assesment in second round to then filter the pool and proceed with required interview rounds. <This message was edited>

12/02/25, 11:20 - Sampath Arni Ravi HR TBC1: Whatâ€™s the context ?
12/02/25, 11:20 - Santhosh Arni Ravi Assistant Manager HR AtoS: What's the context?
12/02/25, 12:21 - Namita Nambiar TA Groww: Iâ€™m looking to understand how different fintech and other companies handle employee trading compliance. Given the risk of insider trading, many firms restrict employees from trading on other platforms or impose specific guidelines.

Iâ€™d love to hear how your company approaches thisâ€”whether itâ€™s through pre-clearance requirements, restricted lists, blackout periods, mandatory disclosures, or other measures. Any insights on industry best practices would be really helpful. <This message was edited>
12/02/25, 12:31 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: Really interested query, following this
12/02/25, 12:34 - Jay Cred hR: you will need to find out someone who has worked with US companies. they would have deeper insights on this.
12/02/25, 13:26 - Kiran Ksheersagar Senior TA Specialist Arcesium: I am working in a similar domain.

During the onboarding process, candidates will go through  compliance training and they have to disclose their trading portfolios. We utilize designated brokers for the transfer of these portfolios.

Our trading requests are managed through a portal called StarCompliance. If an individual wishes to trade, they must submit a request via StarCompliance. Approval is typically granted within 15 minutes, provided the stock is not related to our which we are dealing with our clients (to avoid insider trading). Additionally, our policy prohibits intraday trading. Any stock purchased must remain in the portfolio for T+31 days.

I anticipate your next question may be about the consequences of failing to declare. During onboarding, employees sign a compliance form which authorizes audits. 

Annual audits are conducted for all employees.

---

Let me know if there's anything else you need!

26/02/25, 16:26 - Rashmi M TA Consultant GrowthX: Hey folks - need some inputs 

What are the expenses as a company we can consider while asking employees to relocate ? Like 
- Hotel for stay 
- â travel 
How can we optimise on these expenses? 

Any inputs here appreciated ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼Thanks in advance.
26/02/25, 16:30 - Shivani Goyal TA Associate: You should consider the services of packers & movers as well.
To optimize, one thing that I can think of is you can partner with some hotel(s) for a stay as they might give a corporate discount, rather than reimbursing every single employee (which shall be expensive), if this is a mass relocation requirement.
26/02/25, 21:19 - Nidhi Kumar HR Head Imagekit.io: 1. One time relocation allowance to cover their relocation expenses.
2. Initial 10-15 days stay arrangement
3. Travel cost
To optimize, you can use service apartments instead of hotels or partner with hotels to negotiate corporate rates. Do not give reimbursement for packers and movers and set a fix sum to be given as allowances.
26/02/25, 21:38 - Varun Kapadia Asst Manager Checkmate: Cost of Packers & Movers, Hotel cost for a week and Real estate agent cost reimbursement to the employee (since the employee won't get much time to hunt for a rented accommodation).

11/03/25, 14:54 - Akshatha B Raj HR ObjectWin Technology: Hey folks!

Weâ€™re transitioning from Work From Home (WFH) to Work From Office (WFO) in the coming weeks, and Iâ€™d love to get some insights on how your teams managed this shift.

A few key questions:

- How did you handle the transition process?
- What was the timeline given for employees to move to a 5-day office schedule?
- For employees based in other cities, how much time were they given to relocate?
- Were any handbooks or documents shared to guide them through the transition?
- What benefits or perks were offered to support employees during this change?

Any input would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance! ğŸ˜Š
11/03/25, 16:48 - Sukant Saxena Sr. Lead TA Leadsquared: 1. CXO announcement, HRBP cascade, manager cascade, open convo on transition timeline but clear expectation setting.
2. â Start with 3 days with rotating depts and then transition to full 5 days within 2 months of announcement 
3. â 3 months with some cases in 5-6 months due to extraneous circumstances around them (based on performance as well)
4. â Yes, a 4 pager
5. â Complete relocation assistance - flights and 10 day accommodation for city transition for full family (booked by admin team) + relocation leave (3 days). Expecting parent employees given special session on transition in city. 
6. â Going above and beyond requires making a list of collection of hottest restaurants, best schools near office, broker names and lists for office area nearby residential, tie ups and support from housing platforms like NoBroker for filing of brokerage slips that company reimburses within relocation kitty per person <This message was edited>
